title: Ticket #4004: Use POST instead of GET for EC2 Query API for RunInstances
description:
The RunInstances action allows the specification of instance metadata ("userdata") up to 16 kB:

AWS instance data

However, Apache is hard-coded to use max URI request length of 8 kB; it requires patching and recompilation to do more, so there's an inherent problem if the userdata is too big. The good news is that the EC2 API states that query requests can be HTTP/HTTPS GET or POST:

AWS query API

and I think one of the most-used client libraries (boto) implements it this way:

https://github.com/boto/boto/blob/develop/boto/ec2/connection.py#L882-L883
